prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Step 1: Create a coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation and a zero translation vector. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system and draw a rectangle using the following lines: - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.4914, 0) - Line 2: (0.4914, 0) to (0.4914, 0.75) - Line 3: (0.4914, 0.75) to (0, 0.75) - Line 4: (0, 0.75) to (0, 0) Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Rotate the sketch according to the Euler angles and translate it using the translation vector in the coordinate system provided (0, 0, 0). Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the sketch by 0.0621 units opposite to the normal to create a three-dimensional rectangular prism. Part 2: Construction of a Curved Rectangular Prism Step 1: Create a coordinate system Create a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation, and the translation vector (0.3569, 0, 0). Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system and draw a rectangle using the following lines: - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.1345, 0) - Line 2: (0.1345, 0) to (0.1345, 0.3362) - Line 3: (0.1345, 0.3362) to (0, 0.3362) - Line 4: (0, 0.3362) to (0, 0) Create a circle with the center point (0.0673, 0.1681) and radius = 0.1681. Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3362. Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Rotate the sketch according to the Euler angles and translate it using the translation vector in the coordinate system provided (0.3569, 0, 0). Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the sketch by 0.0776 units opposite to the normal, removing the unwanted material, forming a curved rectangular prism. Part 3: Construction of a Tapered Rectangular Prism Step 1: Create a coordinate system Create a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation, and the translation vector (0, 0, 0). Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system and draw the same rectangle as Part 1 using the following lines: - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.1345, 0) - Line 2: (0.1345, 0) to (0.1345, 0.3362) - Line 3: (0.1345, 0.3362) to (0, 0.3362) - Line 4: (0, 0.3362) to (0, 0) Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3362. Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Rotate the sketch according to the Euler angles and translate it using the translation vector in the coordinate system provided (0, 0, 0). Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the sketch by 0.0776 units opposite to the normal, removing the unwanted material, creating a tapered rectangular prism. These instructions, when followed, will create the desired rectangular prism with slight tapering and curved and triangular cutouts.</description>

For the cylindrical hole, extrude it by the same depth of 0.75 units along the negative Z-axis. This will create a combination of cut and join features on the prism. To visualize the expected outcome, imagine a solid cylinder being subtracted from a solid rectangular prism. The remaining geometry will form the final shape, which is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The final dimensions of the part are: - Length: 0.6494 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.6494 units</description>
